europeana:record.dc:title: De spinachtigen (Arachnida) van de ondergrondse kalksteengroeven in Zuid-Limburg
Zoologische Bijdragen
europeana:record.dc:creator: Hammen, van der L.
europeana:record.dc:subject: Arthropoda
europeana:record.dc:description: A study is made of the Arachnid fauna of the subterranean limestone quarries in Southern Limburg, The Netherlands. About a hundred quarries have been investigated, and ten species of Opilionida, three species of Pseudoscorpionida and fifty-six species of Araneida are listed here. Among the species most frequently met with are: Nesticus cellulanus (Clerck), Meta merianae (Scopoli), Lepthyphantes pallidus (O. P.-Cambridge), Tegenaria silvestris L. Koch, Meta menardi (Latreille), Lepthyphantes leprosus (Ohlert), Amaurobius ferox (Walckenaer) and Paranemastoma quadripunctatum (Perty) (species arranged according to decreasing frequency).
europeana:record.dcterms:isPartOf: De spinachtigen (Arachnida) van de ondergrondse kalksteengroeven in Zuid-Limburg (URN:ISSN:0459-1801) (Volume 29) (Issue 1)
